{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3549602,"name":"João Felipe de Oliveira Marques ","username":"JFelipe33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jfelipe33/{size}/253641_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T18:56:24.313Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone!

I started my studies on hardware and embedded systems for the development of innovative projects in college (for the battlebot team I am part of) and I came across extremely high-quality products from NVIDIA, which would certainly be of great advantage for computer vision, autonomous navigation and robotic simulations in the face of tools and parts in solutions at the FIRST Robotics Competition!

I don’t see many teams mentioning this, from kits like Jetson Nano Orin or Isaac for Physical AI! I would like to know if FIRST prohibits the use of such components or if they are allowed? If so, could a mentor or team member contact me to understand about good practices with the new potential materials through the control system in our robot?

Please! I thank you for your attention and availability in advance! Bye!

I’d recommend you search (through Google, the CD search is not optimal), the terms “Chief Delphi” and “Jetson”

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T18:59:11.915Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":501,"readers_count":500,"score":105.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":494516,"topic_slug":"nvidia-hardware-in-first-robotics-competition-incredible-choice-but-is-legal","display_username":"Lavi Arzi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53351,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5990 Controls/Strategy Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/nvidia-hardware-in-first-robotics-competition-incredible-choice-but-is-legal/494516/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3549607,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T18:59:14.632Z","cooked":"

There’s no specific rule for FRC regarding coprocessors, but the key one that affects what can be used is there’s a $600 fair market value price limit for individual components (R301). There are several teams successfully using Nvidia hardware under this limit as coprocessors.

Ok, thanks Mr.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-03-06T19:00:16.925Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":465,"readers_count":464,"score":93.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":494516,"topic_slug":"nvidia-hardware-in-first-robotics-competition-incredible-choice-but-is-legal","display_username":"João Felipe de Oliveira Marques ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":53351,"username":"LaviRZ","name":"Lavi Arzi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lavirz/{size}/176648_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67908,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2023"},"post_url":"/t/nvidia-hardware-in-first-robotics-competition-incredible-choice-but-is-legal/494516/4","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3549609,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-06T19:00:21.773Z","cooked":"

It is legal, and some teams have great success with it (BOM costs permitting). A notable one is 195, which use the Jetson and ROS to do all the actual thinking, and just use the RoboRio as a dumb controller node to comply with control policies for FRC.

195 Conference Presentation Slides (ROS, Scouting, Sponsorships) Championship Event
Some folks had asked so here’s links to the slide decks from our three presentations. Unfortunately we didn’t record them (lesson learned) - if there’s enough interest maybe we’ll shoot a video of the talking points at home. Thanks to everybody that attended and feel free to reach out to us here, or at info@team195.com or at our helpline: https://www.team195.com/knight-line or for the next few days stop by and see us on Hopper! Scouting Sponsorships ROS

Congratulations! Thank you Sr.

We actually had not so amazing luck with some of the Xavier NX carrier boards we tried (seemingly from a shock and vibe perspective) and are using an orange pi to run ROS these days.

The SOMs are unsurprisingly rock solid, but you may want to be selective with your choice of carrier! Just a word of advice.

It’s legal - snowflake donated two jetson processors and two stereolab zed cameras, they are not being used this season but maybe next year.
